## Data Center Tier Complexity

::: {style="margin: 48px 0;"}
### Understanding Tier Classifications

::: {style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr)); gap: 24px; margin: 32px 0;"}

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Tier I - Basic Capacity
**Uptime:** 99.671% (28.8 hrs/yr downtime)  
**Redundancy:** N  
**Timeline:** 5-6 days  
**Typical Cost:** £4,000-6,000/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- Single power & cooling path
- Non-redundant components
- Planned maintenance requires shutdown
- Basic infrastructure
- Suitable for small offices/edge sites
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Tier II - Redundant Components
**Uptime:** 99.741% (22.0 hrs/yr downtime)  
**Redundancy:** N+1 components  
**Timeline:** 6-7 days  
**Typical Cost:** £5,000-8,000/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- Single power & cooling path
- Redundant components (N+1)
- Some maintenance without shutdown
- Improved infrastructure
- Suitable for SME operations
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Tier III - Concurrently Maintainable
**Uptime:** 99.982% (1.6 hrs/yr downtime)  
**Redundancy:** N+1 systems  
**Timeline:** 7-9 days  
**Typical Cost:** £7,000-11,000/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- Multiple power & cooling paths
- One path active, one passive
- Maintenance without impact
- 2N redundancy on critical systems
- Enterprise/colocation standard
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Tier IV - Fault Tolerant
**Uptime:** 99.995% (0.4 hrs/yr downtime)  
**Redundancy:** 2N+1  
**Timeline:** 9-10 days  
**Typical Cost:** £10,000-15,000+/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- Multiple active power & cooling paths
- Fault tolerant infrastructure
- No single point of failure
- Compartmentalized systems
- Hyperscale/mission-critical
:::

:::
:::

## Key Cost Drivers in Data Center Projects

::: {style="margin: 48px 0; padding: 32px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-radius: 8px;"}
### Typical Cost Breakdown (Tier III, per sqm)

::: {style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 32px; margin: 24px 0;"}

::: {style=""}
#### Electrical Systems (35-40%)
- UPS systems: £800-1,200/sqm
- Generators & ATS: £600-900/sqm
- PDU/busway distribution: £500-800/sqm
- Lighting & small power: £200-300/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £2,100-3,200/sqm
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Mechanical Systems (25-30%)
- CRAC/CRAH units: £700-1,000/sqm
- Chilled water plant: £500-800/sqm
- Hot/cold aisle containment: £200-350/sqm
- Air handling & ducting: £300-500/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £1,700-2,650/sqm
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Building Fabric (15-20%)
- Raised floor systems: £200-350/sqm
- Structural envelope: £600-900/sqm
- Security & access control: £150-250/sqm
- Fire protection: £200-300/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £1,150-1,800/sqm
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Other Elements (15-20%)
- IT infrastructure: £400-600/sqm
- BMS & monitoring: £250-400/sqm
- External works: £200-350/sqm
- Preliminaries (15%): £900-1,400/sqm
- Contingency (8-10%): £600-900/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £2,350-3,650/sqm
:::

:::

::: {style="text-align: center; margin-top: 32px; padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-charcoal); border-radius: 8px;"}
<h3 style="color: #FFFFFF; margin-top: 0;">Total Typical Range: £7,300-11,300/sqm</h3>
<p style="color: #FFFFFF; font-style: italic;">(Tier III standard, excluding land, fees, and IT equipment)</p>

<p style="color: #FFFFFF;"><strong>NOTE:</strong> Actual costs vary significantly based on:</p>
<ul style="color: #FFFFFF; text-align: left; display: inline-block;">
<li>Tier classification (I-IV)</li>
<li>Power density (kW per rack)</li>
<li>Redundancy requirements</li>
<li>Location and infrastructure</li>
<li>Security and compliance levels</li>
</ul>
:::
:::

## Our Data Center Estimation Process

::: {.process-steps}
::: {.process-step}
#### Initial Review & Requirements

**Day 1-2 (6-8 hours)**

**What We Do:**
- Review BIM model (IFC/Revit) and MEP coordination
- Verify tier classification requirements
- Analyze power density and cooling needs
- Identify redundancy configurations
- Assess security and access requirements

**Client Provides:**
- Architectural, structural & MEP models
- Tier specification documents
- Power density requirements
- Site infrastructure details
- Security protocols

**Output:** Project plan with tier verification
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### MEP Systems Analysis

**Days 2-4**

**What We Do:**
- Extract all electrical systems (UPS, generators, PDU)
- Quantify mechanical systems (CRAC, chillers)
- Calculate cable/conduit requirements
- Verify redundancy configurations
- Check compliance with tier standards

**Technology:**
- BIM 5D MEP extraction
- Load calculation verification
- Clash detection review
- N+1/2N system validation

**Output:** Complete MEP quantity take-off
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Building Systems Quantification

**Days 3-5**

**What We Do:**
- Quantify raised floor systems
- Calculate structural requirements
- Measure fire suppression systems
- Count security/access components
- Assess cable management infrastructure

**Coverage:**
- White space & grey space
- Support areas & offices
- Loading dock & deliveries
- Emergency systems

**Output:** Building fabric BOQ
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Cost Application & Modeling

**Days 5-7**

**What We Do:**
- Apply specialist MEP rates
- Factor in tier-specific requirements
- Calculate redundancy premiums
- Include installation complexity
- Model alternative scenarios
- Add contingency (8-12% typical)

**Database Sources:**
- Specialist data center benchmarks
- MEP contractor quotes
- Equipment manufacturer pricing
- Recent project comparisons

**Output:** Detailed cost estimate with tier breakdown
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Quality Review & Verification

**Days 7-9**

**What We Do:**
- Technical peer review
- Tier standard compliance check
- Redundancy verification
- PUE calculation review
- Benchmark comparison
- Risk assessment

**Deliverables:**
- Executive summary (3-5 pages)
- Cost breakdown by system
- MEP-focused BOQ
- Tier compliance report
- Alternative scenarios
- Risk register

**Format:** PDF + Excel workbooks
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Presentation & Support

**Days 9-10**

**What We Do:**
- Present findings to technical team
- Explain critical MEP cost drivers
- Review tier compliance
- Discuss value engineering options
- Answer technical questions
- Provide ongoing support

**Meeting Options:**
- In-person (UK only)
- Video conference (all locations)
- Technical workshop format

**Support:** 60 days post-delivery for Tier III/IV
:::
:::

::: {style="text-align: center; margin: 32px 0; padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-radius: 8px;"}
**Typical Total Duration:** 7-10 working days from BIM model receipt to final report  
**Express Service:** Available for urgent projects (5-6 days) at 30% premium
:::

## Frequently Asked Questions

::: {.faq-section}
::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What makes data center estimation different from other building types?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Data centers are 60-70% MEP systems (vs 20-30% for typical buildings), with complex redundancy requirements, mission-critical reliability standards, and power densities 10-50x higher than office buildings. Traditional estimation methods often miss critical MEP interdependencies and redundancy specifications.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you estimate data centers at different tier levels?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Yes, we have extensive experience with all tier classifications (I through IV). We verify compliance with tier standards and can model cost differences between tier levels to support decision-making. Tier III and IV projects typically require 9-10 days due to their complexity.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How do you handle N+1 and 2N redundancy requirements?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We systematically verify redundancy configurations for all critical systems (power, cooling, network paths). Our 5D BIM workflow identifies each redundant component and ensures proper load distribution, maintenance bypass capability, and concurrent maintainability where required.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What power density ranges can you accommodate?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We handle the full spectrum from standard density (5-10 kW per rack) through high density (10-20 kW) to hyperscale (20-30+ kW). Our analysis includes electrical infrastructure sizing, cooling capacity requirements, and future expansion provisions for each density scenario.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Do you include IT equipment in your estimates?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We focus on the building infrastructure and MEP systems. IT equipment (servers, storage, networking gear) is typically excluded but we can include allowances based on client specifications. We always clarify the scope boundary at project inception.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How quickly can you assess the cost impact of design changes?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Because we work with 5D BIM, most design changes can be re-costed within 4-8 hours. This includes changes to power density, cooling strategy, redundancy level, or tier classification. Complex changes affecting multiple systems may require 1-2 days.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you help with PUE (Power Usage Effectiveness) calculations?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Yes, we can model expected PUE based on the proposed cooling strategy, climate zone, and equipment efficiency. We can also compare alternative cooling approaches (air-cooled vs water-cooled, free cooling, etc.) and their cost/efficiency tradeoffs.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What's your fee structure for data center projects?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Fees vary based on tier level, size, and complexity. As a guide:
- Tier I/II (500-2,000 sqm): £8,000-15,000
- Tier III (2,000-5,000 sqm): £15,000-30,000
- Tier III (5,000-10,000+ sqm): £30,000-50,000
- Tier IV (any size): Premium pricing due to complexity

Express service carries a 30% premium. Contact us for a specific quote.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Do you support edge computing facilities and modular data centers?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Yes, we work with edge facilities, containerized solutions, and modular data centers. Our approach scales from single-rack edge nodes to multi-MW modular deployments. We understand the unique cost dynamics of prefabricated and rapidly deployed solutions.
:::
:::
:::
